data.title: Simple Graffiti
data.statement:
You are paid by a farmer to paint his fence.

Knowing that the task can be too difficult for yourself, you have sub-contracted the job to a class of students, as their extracurricular activity, to draw graffiti on the fence.

After a whole day of work and fun, the students reported which sections of the fence had been painted. The students were working in small teams or individually, so you received multiple separate reports from them.

The fence has markings on it at every meter, counting upwards from <<meter 0>>. A painted section is reported as [[st]] [[ed]]: two integers meaning that the section of the fence from <<meter [[st]]>> to <<meter [[ed]]>> has been painted.

<<Example>>

`    st      ed
    !░░░░░░░░!
 +--+--+--+--+--+--
 0  1  2  3  4  5`
st = 1
ed = 4
painted length = 3


The painted sections may be on any part of the fence. Some reported sections overlap. The reports are not sorted in any special order.

With the reports in hand, you want to know how many meters of the fence have <<not>> been painted.
data.stubGenerator:
read L:int
read N:int
loop N read st:int ed:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[L]] for the total length of the fence in meters
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of reports
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Each line defines a reported section, by the two integers [[st]] & [[ed]].
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> The total length of unpainted fence in meters.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are paid by a farmer to paint his fence.

Knowing that the task can be too difficult for yourself, you have sub-contracted the job to a class of students, as their extracurricular activity, to draw graffiti on the fence.

After a whole day of work and fun, the students reported which sections of the fence had been painted. The students were working in small teams or individually, so you received multiple separate reports from them.

The fence has markings on it at every meter, counting upwards from meter 0. A painted section is reported as st ed: two integers meaning that the section of the fence from meter st to meter ed has been painted.

Example

    st      ed
    !░░░░░░░░!
 +--+--+--+--+--+--
 0  1  2  3  4  5

st = 1
ed = 4
painted length = 3


The painted sections may be on any part of the fence. Some reported sections overlap. The reports are not sorted in any special order.

With the reports in hand, you want to know how many meters of the fence have not been painted.
Input
Line 1: An integer L for the total length of the fence in meters
Line 2: An integer N for the number of reports
Next N lines: Each line defines a reported section, by the two integers st & ed.
Output
Line 1 : The total length of unpainted fence in meters.
Constraints
1 ≤ L ≤ 1,000,000
1 ≤ N ≤ 100
Example
Input
10
2
1 4
5 6
Output
6
